definitions.definition: To be superior in strength , dominance , influence , or frequency ; to have or gain the advantage over others; to have the upper hand ; to outnumber others.
examples: Red colour prevails in the Canadian flag.

definitions.definition: To be current , widespread , or predominant ; to have currency or prevalence .
examples: In his day and age, such practices prevailed all over Europe.

definitions.definition: To succeed in persuading or inducing .
examples: I prevailed on him to wait.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To be superior in strength , dominance , influence , or frequency ; to have or gain the advantage over others; to have the upper hand ; to outnumber others.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To triumph ; to be victorious .
( intransitive ) To be current , widespread , or predominant ; to have currency or prevalence .
( intransitive ) To succeed in persuading or inducing .
